meanings.definition: The act of revoking or annulling a decision or contract.
meanings.sent1: The recision of the contract was a relief for both parties involved.
meanings.sent2: The recision of the decision was met with mixed reactions from the team.
meanings.sent3: After the recision of the contract, they all breathed a sigh of relief.
meanings.sent4: Her recision of the agreement cut ties that had bound them for years.
meanings.sent5: The recision of the decision echoed through the office, leaving a sense of uncertainty.

meanings.definition: The act of cutting off or removing.
meanings.sent1: The recision of the damaged part was necessary for the machine to function properly.
meanings.sent2: The recision of the tree branch made way for more sunlight to reach the garden.
meanings.sent3: The recision of the old wallpaper revealed a hidden message from decades ago.
meanings.sent4: His recision of the rope set the trapped bird free.
meanings.sent5: The recision of the excess material left a clean and precise edge.
